Welcome

The Settle Project was created as an online résumé to showcase projects, work experience and other miscellaneous activities.

View my projects

Scroll down to see some of the major projects I've worked on. From biological movie analysis to university course registration to educational webapps. The list is always growing!

Contact me

Previous Next

My name is Brett Settle and this is my homepage. I am currently working as a Programmer Analyst II for the Ideker Lab at UCSD, and learning new technologies in my free time. While most of my projects are personal, there are several work-related repositories that I've kept with me through the years. If something interests you, let me know. I'm always looking for new projects or ways to improve old ones.

Projects

Cytograph is a graph theory playground that enables users to quickly create mock networks and even execute javascript algorithms on networks. Scripts and networks can be shared via an online database.

Cytograph
Flika

Flika was developed in the Parker-Smith Molecular Biology Lab at the University of California, Irvine, as an expansion upon an automatic calcium activity analysis algorithm. Flika was developed in Python and built to provide a wide variety of image processing tools to research labs. The software uses pyqtgraph, numpy, and sklearn to provide a real-time interactive analysis platform for all kinds of analysis. I also implemented a plugin and macro support system for easily replayable automated algorithms.

Zotplanner was created during my senior year at UC Irvine as an augmentation to the course registration process. By merging the 3 websites used to register for classes: DegreeWorks for major requirements, AntPlanner for searching and schedule planning, and WebReg for actually registering, my webapp lets the student easily browse the available courses that they need for their degree. UCI is now working to implement a similar system into their own website! (May break in the near future)

Zotplanner
Redwall

Redwall was developed as a python Reddit wallpaper scraper, and grew into a streamable image generator and rating system. Set your wallpaper to iterate through the images on any subreddit, download them with a single button!

Checkout my github repositories to see projects spanning all the way from my very first program to my ongoing projects.

My Github
